title: Significant Digits/Significant Figures

sections.title: Definition of Significant Digits
sections.heading: What are significant digits/significant figures?
sections.content: These are the valid digits in a measurement.

sections.title: Use of Significant Digits
sections.heading: What are significant digits used for?
sections.content: When performing any arithmetic operation, the result never can be more precise than the least precise measurement. Significant digits are used for showing the precision of measurements in chemistry, Math or other disciplines.

sources.name: McAlister, D., Pierce, S., & Cardenas, R.
sources.title: Significant Figure | Definition, Importance & Examples

sections.title: Rules for Significant Digits
sections.heading: Rules for understanding significant digits
bullet_points: All digits different to zero are significant
The zeros between two significant digits are significant.
The zeros used to locate the decimal point are not significant.

sections.title: Practice Identifying Significant Digits
sections.heading: Practice exercises: Choose the amount  of significant digits/significant figures in each number.

sections.title: Arithmetic Operations with Significant Digits
sections.heading: How to use it in mathematical operations

subsections.title: Addition or Subtraction
step_by_step: Round off the result to correspond to the least-precise value involved

subsections.title: Multiplication or Division
step_by_step: Round to the same number of significant digits as the least-precise measurement
Example: 409.2 km / 11.4 L = 35.9 km/L because the least-precise measure has three significant digits
